items: Learn the six main comparison operators in Python
Use comparison results in if statements

sections.heading: What are comparison operators?
paragraphs: A comparison operator compares two values and returns a Boolean (True or False).

sections.heading: Real-life analogy
bullets: == → I will buy it if the price equals 10 dollars.
!= → I will buy it if it’s not 10 dollars.
> → I will go running if the temperature is greater than 15°C.

sections.heading: Try it
bullets: Use if score >= 90: to print "A grade."
Add elif score >= 80: to print "B grade."
Add an else: to print "Below B grade."
Change score to test different results.
Often used with if statements for decision-making

questions.prompt: Which operator would you use to check if a value is at least 100?
